page.title: 15Wildlife
page.content:
The Grizedale Valley is surrounded by forest. Most of the forest is coniferous trees but there are areas of natural deciduous woodland. The area is rich in wildlife. The most spectacular animal is the {red deer} which is common in Grizedale as is the {red squirrel. {} {The pied flycatcher,}a very local species in Britain, is plentiful in our forest. There is also a bird called the{redstart}which you can recognise by its chestnut tail. The {tree pippit}is noticeable for the song it sings while gliding. The largest of the tit family,{the great tit,}is very agile, especially when extracting nuts from containers.
The largest common bird of prey is the{buzzard.}
